issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
When creating a module the platform folders do not get created

_The below is for iOS but is relevant for all platforms_

*Test steps:*
# Open Appc Studio
# Create a new module (File -> New -> Mobile App project)
# When creating a module select the latest SDK from master (8.0.0.v20181121114345)
# Open project and check if iOS folder has been created

*Actual result*
iOS folder can not be seen once a new module has been 'created'.

*Expected result* 
iOS folder should be created when creating a new module.
fields.summary: CLI: Unable to create module using latest the build from Master
fields.environment:
SDK version: 8.0.0.v20181121114345
APPC Studio: 5.1.0.201808080937
iPhone 7 Sim (iOS 12.1)
APPC CLI: 7.0.8-5
Operating System Name: Mac OS Mojave
Operating System Version: 10.14.1
Node.js Version: 8.9.1
Xcode 10.1

comments.body:
*Closing ticket.* Fix verified in SDK version {{8.0.0.v20181127032313}}.

Test and other information can be found at"
https://github.com/appcelerator/titanium_mobile/pull/10489
